About Me

Hi I am Daniel Osborne ,
I recently graduated from college with a bachelors in Network Administration. I have strong interests in networking and virtualization as well as interests in cybersecurity and programming. Recently I’ve been dipping my toes in different scripting languages for use with services and applications in my home lab. My goal is to gain experience in the field of IT and learn as much as I can along the way.

Information Technology Specialist 2, NYS ITS

2023 — Present

Following my internship, I was hired on a more permanent basis with the same responsibilities as the former position, but with more projects and less supervision. Key responsibilities include:

  • Test, Design, and develop Proof of Concepts (PoCs) for potential network solutions.
  • Assist in deploying, managing, and troubleshooting network solutions.
  • Work with vendors to better develop and design network solutions for NYS using vendor products.
  • Research new relevant technologies and their vendors.
  • Perform vendor intake and run meetings.

Student Assistant, NYS ITS

2023 — 2023

Hired as a student assistant during my last semester of college. Key responsibilities included:

  • Test, Design, and develop Proof of Concepts (PoCs) for potential network solutions.
  • Assist in deploying, managing, and troubleshooting network solutions.
  • Work with vendors to better develop and design network solutions for NYS using vendor products.
  • Research new relevant technologies and their vendors.
  • Perform vendor intake and run meetings.

Student, Alfred State College Network Administration BTECH

2020 — 2023 | GPA: 3.24

After graduating from SUNY Adirondack, I transfered to Alfred State College to further my education and to obtain my bachelors degree. The coursework here exposed us to host security, zone based firewalling with Palo Alto and Cisco ASAs, virtualization with ESXI and ProxMox, programming with C# and Javascript, risk management, project management, and ethics.

Student, SUNY Adirondack IT: Computer Networking AAS

2017 — 2020 | GPA: 3.23

I Attended SUNY Adirondack while attending high school through the BOCES Early College Career Academy. While attending SUNY Adirondack, the coursework we were exposed to taught us the fundamentals of routing and switching, computer operating systems and hardware, and about information security. Other coursework included Windows Server, SQL, PHP, and Visual Basic.
